positions.title: Associate Software Engineer
key_events: Helped develop React Facet npm package with a team of UI programmers to optimize the internal reconciliation algorithm by altering React’s rendering strategy in order to replace the standard state management

Refactored more than 90% of UI components to use React Facet rather than the standard React states which optimized the average time to update and re-render components from ∼360ms to ∼25ms during each tick
Resolved various memory management and invalid reference bugs in C++ codebase by utilizing smart pointers

Built the in-game marketplace’s back-end features such as item purchase and entitlement redemption by utilizing Azure PlayFab and platform-specific native APIs, to handle over 50,000 daily transactions
Implementing and maintaining various UI features on Bedrock Engine while collaborating with UI/UX designers

positions.title: Software Engineer Co-op
key_events: Implemented over 15 complex UI components and their back-end APIs while coordinating with UI/UX designers

Delivered over 30 application crash bugs by collaborating with Coherent Gameface to resolve the demanding issues encountered on middleware integration to allow for a smoother UI development by using React on Bedrock Engine
Built a debug mode into the front-end, making it easier to detect segmentation faults and uncaught JS exceptions
Migrated complex JavaScript front-end functions to C++ back-end codebase to optimize runtime performance

positions.title: Software Engineer Co-op
key_events: Addressed production bugs and features such as creating a REST API for leaderboard system, solving critical monetization issues on backend servers, and integrating third-party services for advertising and A/B testing

Executed a large scale C# script refactor which reduced a total of ∼3000 lines of code to ∼800 lines of code by applying SOLID principles and utilizing C# Generics for a more concise, less error-prone codebase
Implemented the backend for a new daily login reward feature using Docker with AWS ECS and Secrets Manager
Participated in coders’ meetings by giving a series of presentations on the Unity’s ECS and Job System
Led a scrum team of 4 programmers and 2 artists to develop an endless runner game with a unique cooking theme
Administered the task management aspect along with milestone planning using scrum boards and regular standups

Designed the code architecture and implemented various design patterns such as object pooling and type-object in C# to optimize the game performance, reduce the code bloat, and make the project less error prone
Managed the official publishing on Google Play Store and App Store for the game’s release life cycle
Developed an optimizing ahead-of-time compiler from a high-level language with functional and imperative features to x86-64 with two other team members

Implemented various compiler passes to add language features such as control flows, immediate and structured data types, and first-class procedures by using Racket’s pattern matching and introducing custom data structures
Optimized the compile & run time by implementing features such as live-variable analysis and register allocation
Developed a DNS lookup service by following the RFC1305 and RFC8499 protocols
Implemented the service to accommodate both recursive and iterative requests along with DNS caching
